tit.e: Gosashi-kofun Tumulus (a tumulus in the Sakitatenami-kofun Tumuli Cluster in Nara City, Nara Prefecture)
Gosashi-kofun Tumulus (a tumulus in the Sakitatenami-kofun Tumuli Cluster in Nara City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 五社神古墳（ごさしこふん）は、奈良県奈良市にある佐紀盾列古墳群に属する古墳。
sen.e: Gosashi Kofun is a kofun (ancient tomb) belonging to the Sakitatenami Kofun Group.
Gosashi-kofun Tumulus is an ancient tomb belonging to the Sakitatenami-kofun Tumuli Cluster in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「奈良県奈良市にある」を補足しました。
sen.e: Gosashi-kofun Tumulus is an ancient tomb belonging to the Sakitatenami-kofun Tumuli Cluster in Nara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 『延喜式』諸陵寮のリストに「狭城楯列池上陵」（さきたたなみいけのえのみささぎ）と記されており、宮内庁は現・神功皇后陵に比定している。
sen.e: It is recorded as "Sakitatanamiikenoenomisa"in the list of "Engeshiki' Shoryoryou, and the Imperial Household Agency identifies it as present Empress Jingu Mausoleum.

It is recorded as 'Sakitatanamiike no e no Misasagi' in the list of Shoryoryo (the Bureau for managing imperial mausoleums) in "Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), and the Imperial Household Agency analogically considers it as present Empress Jingu Mausoleum.
sen.cmt: 読み修正、用語補足などしました。
sen.e: It is recorded as 'Sakitatanamiike no e no Misasagi' in the list of Shoryoryo (the Bureau for managing imperial mausoleums) in "Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), and the Imperial Household Agency analogically considers it as present Empress Jingu Mausoleum.

sen.j: 女性のために造営したとみられる古墳である。
sen.e: It is a kofun thought to have been built for a woman.
It is a tumulus thought to have been built for a woman.
It is a tumulus thought to have been built for a woman.

sen.j: 幕末・天皇陵文久の修陵による周壕の拡張を確認。
sen.e: At the end of Edo period, the extension of the shugo (loop moat) under the Bunkyu's Imperial Mausoleums Repairs was verified.
At the end of Edo period, the extension of the shugo (surrounding moat) under the Bunkyu Restoration of Imperial Mausoleums was verified.
At the end of Edo period, the extension of the shugo (surrounding moat) under the Bunkyu Restoration of Imperial Mausoleums was verified.

sen.j: 2004年に15学・協会に公開された。
sen.e: In 2004 it was opened to fifteen academic societies/associations.
In 2004 it was opened to 15 academic societies and associations.
In 2004 it was opened to 15 academic societies and associations.

sen.j: 2008年、宮内庁が陵墓としては初めて日本考古学協会を窓口とする16学・協会の要望による立ち入り調査を許可し、同年2月22日に実施され16名が立ち入った。
sen.e: In 2008 the Imperial Household Agency for the first time permitted 16 academic societies/associations fronted by the Japanese Archaeological Association to enter the mausoleum for research, which was conducted on February 22 of the same year by sixteen people.

In 2008 the Imperial Household Agency for the first time permitted the request of 16 academic societies and associations fronted by the Japanese Archaeological Association to enter the mausoleum for research, which was conducted on February 22 of the same year by 16 people.
sen.cmt: アラビア数字にし、補足しました。
sen.e: In 2008 the Imperial Household Agency for the first time permitted the request of 16 academic societies and associations fronted by the Japanese Archaeological Association to enter the mausoleum for research, which was conducted on February 22 of the same year by 16 people.

sen.j: 前方部東側の墳丘裙やや外側ではそれまで知られていなかった円筒埴輪列が原位置のまま確認された。
sen.e: A row of cylindrical haniwa (clay figure) which had not been known before were found in their original position at the mound hem and outside of the east side of the front part.
A row of cylindrical haniwa (clay figure) which had not been known before were found in their original position at the mound hem and outside of the east side of the front square part.
A row of cylindrical haniwa (clay figure) which had not been known before were found in their original position at the mound hem and outside of the east side of the front square part.

tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 所在地：奈良県奈良市山陵町宮ノ谷
sen.e: Location: Miyanotani, Sanryo-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture
Location: Miyanotani, Sanryo-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture
Location: Miyanotani, Sanryo-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture

sen.j: 被葬者：不明（宮内庁は神功皇后としている）
sen.e: Buried person: Unknown (the Imperial Household Agency identifies it as Empress Jingu)
Buried person: Unknown (the Imperial Household Agency identifies it as Empress Jingu)
Buried person: Unknown (the Imperial Household Agency identifies it as Empress Jingu)

sen.j: 築造時期：古墳時代前期後半（4世紀後半〜5世紀初頭）
sen.e: Time of Construction: The latter half of the early Kofun period (the latter half of the 4th century to the beginning of the 5th century)
Time of Construction: The latter half of the early Kofun period (the latter half of the fourth century to the beginning of the fifth century)
sen.cmt: スペルアウトしました。
sen.e: Time of Construction: The latter half of the early Kofun period (the latter half of the fourth century to the beginning of the fifth century)

sen.j: 墳 形：前方後円墳（葺石あり）
sen.e: Tomb shape: Zenpokoenfun (fukiishi stones found)
Tomb shape: A keyhole-shaped mound (fukiishi [a stone covering an old tomb] stones found)
sen.cmt: 用語を変え、用語補足しました。
sen.e: Tomb shape: A keyhole-shaped mound (fukiishi [a stone covering an old tomb] stones found)

sen.j: 規 模：全長約275m・後円部径約195m、後円部高さ23m、前方部幅155m、前方部高さ27m
sen.e: Size: Full length about 275 meters, the back circular part about 195 meters in diameter and 23 meters in height, the front part 155 meters in width and 27 meters in height,
Size: Full length is approximately 275 meters, the back circular part approximately 195 meters in diameter and 23 meters in height, the front square part 155 meters in width and 27 meters in height
Size: Full length is approximately 275 meters, the back circular part approximately 195 meters in diameter and 23 meters in height, the front square part 155 meters in width and 27 meters in height

sen.j: 地形図：『陵墓地形図集成』（学生社）に2m刻みのものを収録
sen.e: Topographical map: Recorded in "Ryobo Chikeizu Shusei" (Gakuseisha) at two-meter intervals
Topographical map: Recorded in "Ryobo Chikeizu Shusei" (Topographic maps of imperial burial mounds) (Gakuseisha, a publisher) at two-meter intervals
Topographical map: Recorded in "Ryobo Chikeizu Shusei" (Topographic maps of imperial burial mounds) (Gakuseisha, a publisher) at two-meter intervals

sen.j: 埋葬部：不明（宮内庁比定のため未調査）
sen.e: Burial spot: Unknown (research untouched because of the identification by the Imperial Household Agency)
Burial spot: Unknown (not researched for the Imperial Household Agency's analogical identification)
Burial spot: Unknown (not researched for the Imperial Household Agency's analogical identification)

sen.j: 出土遺物：2003年宮内庁調査
sen.e: Unearthed goods: Investigated by the Imperial Household Agency in 2003
Unearthed goods: Investigated by the Imperial Household Agency in 2003
Unearthed goods: Investigated by the Imperial Household Agency in 2003

sen.j: 壺形埴輪（4世紀中葉から後半）
sen.e: Jar-shaped haniwa (the middle 4th century to the latter half)
Jar-shaped haniwa (the middle fourth century to the latter half)
sen.cmt: スペルアウトしました。
sen.e: Jar-shaped haniwa (the middle fourth century to the latter half)

sen.j: 円筒埴輪（4世紀中葉から後半）
sen.e: Cylindrical haniwa (the middle 4th century to the latter half)
Cylindrical haniwa (the middle fourth century to the latter half)
sen.cmt: スペルアウトしました。
sen.e: Cylindrical haniwa (the middle fourth century to the latter half)
